node.title: Widow claims millions in damages after husband and son drown in lagoon
node.alt: An outdoor pool on a sunny day in the tropics.
node.description: Jie Tan's 30-year-old husband and five-year-old son drowned at Airlie Beach Lagoon in 2018. Now she's suing the council and the lifeguard service contractor.
node.content:
["It was supposed to be an enjoyable day out in paradise\u00a0but it ended leaving\u00a0a\u00a0family in tatters.", "A young Chinese couple and their five-year-old child were enjoying time at the Airlie Beach Lagoon in October 2018, but only one of them returned to China.", "Yuanwei Zang and his son Chenxi went into the water together, but despite the lagoon being busy with swimmers, no-one noticed them slip under the water and never resurface.", "Now the Whitsunday Regional Council, which operates the lagoon, and the lifeguard service contractor services are being sued by Mr Zhang's widow.", "", "
Jie Tan and her son Chenxi enjoyed time in Sydney in the days before they travelled to the Whitsundays.(Supplied: Jie Tan)
", "
Allegations of negligence
", "Court documents obtained by the ABC outline the claim against the council and the contractor.", "Lawyers for Jie Tan say that negligence was to blame for the deaths of the 30-year-old father and his son.", "The documents claim the two lifeguards on duty at the time of the incident failed to keep a proper lookout, were talking with each other,\u00a0were distracted and failed to retrieve the father when he encountered difficulty.", "", "
Jie Tan, her husband Yuanwei Zeng and their five-year-old son Chenxi days before the tragedy.(Supplied: Jie Tan)
", "\"At about 3.40pm the deceased began to experience difficulties and flounder in the water before disappearing below the surface, whereupon Chenxi too disappeared below the surface,\" the document stated.", "It was six minutes before Mr Zhang was retrieved from the bottom of the lagoon and\u00a0a further seven minutes before the child was pulled to the surface.", "Neither could be revived.", "It is understood neither Mr Zhang nor his son could swim.", "", "
Flowers were placed by mourners after the tragedy.(ABC Tropical North: Tara Cassidy)
", "
The cost of a life
", "Mr Zhang was a senior pilot with Chongqing Airlines\u00a0and wife Jie Tan worked as a intermediate flight dispatcher.", "Their annual\u00a0earnings of about 1.4 million yuan ($307,000)\u00a0put them in the top 20 per cent of incomes in China.", "The court documents show that part of Mr Zhang's income supported his parents, as well as his immediate family.", "Littles Lawyers are claiming damages of more than 20 million yuan\u00a0\u2014 about $4.5 million.", "That includes past and future lost earnings due to Mr Zhang's death, past and future superannuation losses, financial loss for his parents and special damages.", "", "
Jie Tan's legal team is claiming that the deaths\u00a0of her son Chenxi and husband Yuanwei Zhang could have been avoided.(Supplied: Jie Tan)
", "
Claims deaths avoidable
", "The court documents, filed in Mackay, claim that both the Whitsunday Regional Council and the contractor Ellmill Enterprise Pty Ltd failed in their duty of care.", "\"The second defendant (Ellmill Enterprise) was to ensure a minimum of two lifeguards were based at the lagoon and actively patrolled around the lagoon,\" the document said.", "\"And that watchtowers in place were manned at all times or the water areas monitored to ensure all areas were supervised adequately.\"", "", "
Legal documents say two lifeguards (not pictured here) were on duty at the time of the incident.(ABC North Queensland \u2014 file photo)
", "It claims the deaths could have been avoided by the exercise of reasonable care.", "\"The second defendant failed to put in place and to enforce a system of observation of users so that reasonable care was taken for the safety of those persons,\" the document said.", "It is understood the company that provided lifeguard services at the lagoon continued to do so until its\u00a0contract expired last year.", "", "
The lagoon was closed for a period of time after the drowning tragedy.(ABC News)
", "A new contractor took over lifeguard services in December.", "The deaths have been extensively investigated by the Office of Workplace Health and Safety, which has since charged the council with failing to comply with a workplace health and safety duty.", "The matter is due to return to court next month.", "The Whitsunday Regional Council declined to comment on the matter because it is\u00a0before the courts."]
